meta.name: keyword
meta.content: wicket, web, j2ee, java, kick start, eclipse, netbeans, intellij, idea

section.name: Kick Start
section.p: This kick start is a small guide to get you up and running to start using Wicket within minutes. This project is meant to be a starting point for your first project. If you are looking for examples, please look at the example projects.
This project has guides to the major three IDE's available:

These kick start guides assume you have some knowlegde of developing Java web applications and using your IDE. This kick start will only give you a working environment, it is not intended as a blueprint project.

section.name: Latest News

subsection.name: April 18, 2005 - Netbeans guide added
subsection.p: Finally we have a Netbeans guide for running the kick start project in Netbeans.

subsection.name: April 15, 2005 - QuickStart has moved
subsection.p: The project formerly known as 'Wicket QuickStart' has moved into the Wicket Stuff project and has been renamed to 'Wicket Kick Start'.

section.p: See the news archive for more (older) news.

section.name: Special Thanks
section.p: The Wicket Stuff development team would like to thank the following partners for supporting Open Source in general and Wicket in particular.
